page.title: 04 WIGHILL SCHOOL
page.content:
The school at Wighill is the only school in the area. It is for children between the ages of 4 and 11. There was a school in the village over a hundred years ago. At one time children used to stay until they were fourteen and as many as fifty children were crammed into the small lofty hall and tiny infant classroom.
The toilets were outside for the children. Until 1978 the headteacher lived at the attached school house. West Riding County Council purchased some adjacent land and built two temporary classrooms with a big playing field. We do lots of different subjects and go on often go on visits.
There are 19 children altogether and one teacher.
